meanings.definition: To make something secular or non-religious.
meanings.sent1: The school decided to secularize their holiday celebrations.
meanings.sent2: The government secularized the public education system.
meanings.sent3: The idea of secularizing the library books made the students chuckle.
meanings.sent4: She secularized her wardrobe by donating all her religious attire.
meanings.sent5: The decision to secularize the event was met with mixed reactions.

meanings.definition: To remove religious influence or control from something.
meanings.sent1: The new law aimed to secularize the legal system.
meanings.sent2: The reform movement sought to secularize the political landscape.
meanings.sent3: The attempt to secularize the ancient temple raised some eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: He tried to secularize his mind from the religious teachings of his childhood.
meanings.sent5: The process of secularizing the traditional ceremony was challenging but necessary.
